abstract.t: Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) is a fault detection protocol that can quickly determine a communication failure between two forwarding engines. This document defines a use of the BFD Echo where the local system supports BFD but the adjacent system does not support BFD. BFD Control packet and its processing procedures can be executed over the BFD Echo port where the adjacent system only loops packets back to the local system. This document updates RFC 5880 by defining a new method of BFD Echo- Only without requiring an implementation to support the full BFD protocol.
